N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 850.4 - Motions

State Regulations
(a) Motions or applications which include requests for interim relief. (1)

Notice. A party seeking relief as
provided in section
1250.4
(b) of this

Title shall, in addition to the notice required by section
1250.4
(b)(2)
of
this Title, provide advance notice to the court of its intention to present the
application or order to show cause. To the extent practicable, the notice
required by section
1250.4
(b)(2)
of
this Title and by this section shall be accompanied by a copy of the papers the
party seeking relief intends to present to the court for filing. The affidavit
or affirmation of notice required by section
1250.4
(b)(2)
of
this Title shall state the manner in which the proposed filing was
served. (2)

Oral argument. Where
the notice required by paragraph (1) of this subdivision has been given, the
party seeking relief and/or the party opposing the relief sought may request
the opportunity to present argument to the justice to whom the application or
order to show cause will be presented, which request shall be determined in the
discretion of that justice. (b) Admission pro hac vice. An application for admission
pro hac
vice, pursuant to section
1250.4
(e) of this

Title, shall be made in the form of a motion. (c) Leave to file amicus curiae
brief. A motion for permission to serve and file an
amicus curiae brief, made pursuant to section
1250.4
(f) of this

Title, shall include one original, five hard copies and one digital copy of the
proposed brief with proof of service of one hard copy of the brief upon each
other party to the appeal or proceeding. Notes
